content: banana socks materials - 3mm dpns - fingering/sock weight yarn toe cast on link to cast on tutorial https //www youtube com/watch v=gv9uafgz6q0 judy s magic co 20 stitches 10 per needle knit 2 rounds toe increases round 1 k1 m1r knit to last stitch on needle m1l k1 repeat for second needle round 2 knit all stitches repeat rounds 1 and 2 until you have 28 stitches per needle total of 56 stitches note you can narrow or widen the sock by having fewer or more increases body note one needle will have the back half of the sock the other needle will have the front half continue to knit in the round using the following pattern back half of sock k2p2 ribbing front half of sock knit all stitches for 5 row purl all stitches for 5 row repeat to desired length cuff k2p2 for 12 row or to desired length bind oa using a stretchy bind oa i like using tubular bind oa but you can use jeny s surprisingly stretchy bind oa if preferred link to bind oa tutorial https //www youtube com/watch v=fnbanlvzbxw
